github-actions[bot] commented on PR #14069:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14069#issuecomment-1239860893

   :warning: Ticket **has no components in JIRA**, make sure you assign one.

kou commented on PR #14069:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14069#issuecomment-1242416758

   Can we apply https://github.com/madler/zlib/commit/ec3df00224d4b396e2ac6586ab5d25f673caa4c2 in https://github.com/madler/zlib/commit/ec3df00224d4b396e2ac6586ab5d25f673caa4c2 instead?

lidavidm commented on PR #14069:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14069#issuecomment-1242812521

   I'll try opening a PR and seeing if there's interest in patching

lidavidm commented on PR #14069:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14069#issuecomment-1243740835

   Patch was accepted, so once I see the new packages go out I'll test unpinning the dependency

lidavidm commented on PR #14069:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14069#issuecomment-1244344740

   Hmm, it failed, but I see it didn't install the most updated zlib…trying again

lidavidm commented on PR #14069:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14069#issuecomment-1244487355

   Looks like a dummy change to bump the cache did the trick - what's the 'right' way to accomplish that?

kou commented on PR #14069:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14069#issuecomment-1244800357

   I'll remove the cached images listed at https://hub.docker.com/r/apache/arrow-dev/tags (admin page: https://hub.docker.com/repository/docker/apache/arrow-dev/tags ).

kou commented on PR #14069:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14069#issuecomment-1244800888

   I've removed `amd64-conda` and `amd64-conda-cpp`.

lidavidm commented on PR #14069:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14069#issuecomment-1244808589

   Thanks! Reverted the last commit, let's see how the build goes now

fields.summary: [CI] conda-integration builds failing due to pinned zlib

comments.body: Looks like we have to pin sqlite in both conda-cpp and conda-integration since the newest builds of sqlite require the newest zlib
